meanings.definition: To use money, resources, or time efficiently.
meanings.sent1: She economized her allowance by saving a portion of it every week.
meanings.sent2: The family economized by carpooling to save on gas expenses.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel economized its acorn stash for the long winter ahead.
meanings.sent4: He economized his energy during the day so he could stay up late studying.
meanings.sent5: The wise old owl taught the young ones to economize their hunting efforts.

meanings.definition: To avoid waste or unnecessary expenditure.
meanings.sent1: They economized on paper by printing on both sides of the sheet.
meanings.sent2: The company economized on office supplies to increase profits.
meanings.sent3: The chef economized on ingredients but still managed to create a delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: She economized on packing space by rolling her clothes instead of folding them.
meanings.sent5: The captain economized on fuel to extend the ship's journey across the vast ocean.
